t: Luke 17
Warnings from Jesus
He*p said to his disciples, “Offenses*r will*r certainly*r come,*r but*r woe*r to*r the*r one*r through*r whom*r they*r come!*r

It*r would*r be*r better*r for*r him*r if*r a*r millstone*r were*r hung*r around*r his*r neck*r and*r he*r were*r thrown*r into*r the*r sea*r than*r for*r him*r to*r cause*r one*r of*r these*r little*r ones*r to*r stumble.*r
Be*r on*r your*r guard.*r If*r your*r brother*r sins,*r rebuke*r him,*r and*r if*r he*r repents,*r forgive*r him.*r
And*r if*r he*r sins*r against*r you*r seven*r times*r in*r a*r day,*r and*r comes*r back*r to*r you*r seven*r times,*r saying,*r ‘I*r repent,’*r you*r must*r forgive*r him.”*r
Faith and Duty
The*p apostles said to the Lord, “Increase our faith.”

“If*rp you*r have*r faith*r the*r size*r of*r a*r mustard*r seed,”*r the Lord said, “you*r can*r say*r to*r this*r mulberry*r tree,*r ‘Be*r uprooted*r and*r planted*r in*r the*r sea,’*r and*r it*r will*r obey*r you.*r

“Which*rp one*r of*r you*r having*r a*r servant*r tending*r sheep*r or*r plowing*r will*r say*r to*r him*r when*r he*r comes*r in*r from*r the*r field,*r ‘Come*r at*r once*r and*r sit*r down*r to*r eat’?*r
Instead,*r will*r he*r not*r tell*r him,*r ‘Prepare*r something*r for*r me*r to*r eat,*r get*r ready,*r and*r serve*r me*r while*r I*r eat*r and*r drink;*r later*r you*r can*r eat*r and*r drink’?*r
Does*r he*r thank*r that*r servant*r because*r he*r did*r what*r was*r commanded?*r
In*r the*r same*r way,*r when*r you*r have*r done*r all*r that*r you*r were*r commanded,*r you*r should*r say,*r ‘We*r are*r unworthy*r servants;*r we’ve*r only*r done*r our*r duty.’”*r
Ten Men Healed
While*p traveling to Jerusalem, he passed between Samaria and Galilee.
As he entered a village, ten men with leprosy met him. They stood at a distance
and raised their voices, saying, “Jesus, Master, have mercy on us!”
When*p he saw them, he told them, “Go*r and*r show*r yourselves*r to*r the*r priests.”*r And while they were going, they were cleansed.
But*p one of them, seeing that he was healed, returned and, with a loud voice, gave glory to God.
He fell facedown at his feet, thanking him. And he was a Samaritan.
Then*p Jesus said, “Were*r not*r ten*r cleansed?*r Where*r are*r the*r nine?*r
Didn’t*r any*r return*r to*r give*r glory*r to*r God*r except*r this*r foreigner?”*r
And he told him, “Get*r up*r and*r go*r on*r your*r way.*r Your*r faith*r has*r saved*r you.”*r
The Coming of the Kingdom
When*p he was asked by the Pharisees when the kingdom of God would come, he answered them, “The*r kingdom*r of*r God*r is*r not*r coming*r with*r something*r observable;*r
no*r one*r will*r say,*r ‘See*r here! ’*r or*r ‘There! ’*r For*r you*r see,*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r is*r in*r your*r midst.”*r
Then*p he told the disciples, “The*r days*r are*r coming*r when*r you*r will*r long*r to*r see*r one*r of*r the*r days*r of*r the*r Son*r of*r Man,*r but*r you*r won’t*r see*r it.*r
They*r will*r say*r to*r you,*r ‘See*r there! ’*r or*r ‘See*r here! ’*r Don’t*r follow*r or*r run*r after*r them.*r
For*r as*r the*r lightning*r flashes*r from*r horizon*r to*r horizon*r and*r lights*r up*r the*r sky,*r so*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r will*r be*r in*r his*r day.*r
But*r first*r it*r is*r necessary*r that*r he*r suffer*r many*r things*r and*r be*r rejected*r by*r this*r generation.*r
“Just*rp as*r it*r was*r in*r the*r days*r of*r Noah,*r so*r it*r will*r be*r in*r the*r days*r of*r the*r Son*r of*r Man:*r

People*r went*r on*r eating,*r drinking,*r marrying*r and*r being*r given*r in*r marriage*r until*r the*r day*r Noah*r boarded*r the*r ark,*r and*r the*r flood*r came*r and*r destroyed*r them*r all.*r
It*r will*r be*r the*r same*r as*r it*r was*r in*r the*r days*r of*r Lot:*r People*r went*r on*r eating,*r drinking,*r buying,*r selling,*r planting,*r building.*r
But*r on*r the*r day*r Lot*r left*r Sodom,*r fire*r and*r sulfur*r rained*r from*r heaven*r and*r destroyed*r them*r all.*r
It*r will*r be*r like*r that*r on*r the*r day*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r revealed.*r

On*r that*r day,*r a*r man*r on*r the*r housetop,*r whose*r belongings*r are*r in*r the*r house,*r must*r not*r come*r down*r to*r get*r them.*r Likewise*r the*r man*r who*r is*r in*r the*r field*r must*r not*r turn*r back.*r
Remember*r Lot’s*r wife!*r
Whoever*r tries*r to*r make*r his*r life*r secure*r will*r lose*r it,*r and*r whoever*r loses*r his*r life*r will*r preserve*r it.*r
I*r tell*r you,*r on*r that*r night*r two*r will*r be*r in*r one*r bed;*r one*r will*r be*r taken*r and*r the*r other*r will*r be*r left.*r
Two*r women*r will*r be*r grinding*r grain*r together;*r one*r will*r be*r taken*r and*r the*r other*r left.”*r
“Where,*p Lord?” they asked him. He*p said to them, “Where*r the*r corpse*r is,*r there*r also*r the*r vultures*r will*r be*r gathered.”*r
